feature:
All messages related to the animations
Animation type.
No animation
The drone makes a flip
The drone horizontaly rotates on itself
The drone flies away on a given distance with a computed angle
The drone starts looking down, then moves forward while slowly looking at the horizon
The drone starts looking down, then moves up while slowly looking at the horizon. When it reaches its target altitude, it rotates on itself to do a panorama.
The drone circles around its target.
The drone makes a parabola on top of its target and ends on the other side of it.
The drone flies horizontally in direction of the target then flies up.
The drone slides horizontally.
Zoom in on the subject, while the drone moves away from it.
The drone moves up while rotating slowly on itself.
The drone place itself above the target, then moves up while rotating slowly on itself.
The drone performs a 180 degrees rotation on the yaw axis while taking photos at various angles. The resulting set of photos can then be retrieved as a single media that may be post-processed to make panoramic images.
The drone camera performs a 180 degrees rotation on the tilt axis while taking photos at various angles. The resulting set of photos can then be retrieved as a single media that may be post-processed to make panoramic images.
The drone performs a 360 degrees rotation on the yaw axis. At various angles, rotation pauses, drone camera performs a 180 degrees rotation on the tilt axis while taking photos at various angles, then drone yaw rotation resumes. The resulting set of photos can then be retrieved as a single media that may be post-processed to make panoramic images.
Animation state.
The animation is not running.
The animation is running.
The current animation is canceling.
Animation play mode.
Animation is played once, normally.
Animation is played once and then the animation is played mirrored.
Animation flip type.
The drone makes a front flip
The drone makes a back flip
The drone makes a left flip (its left side goes up)
The drone makes a right flip (its right side goes up)

Bitfield of the config parameters on which given values should be used. Setting a bit to 1 means that the corresponding parameter should be used, otherwise default value should be used.
Desired speed in m/s. Not used when speed of provided_params param is 0.
Desired relative radius variation. A value of 2 means that the ending radius will be twice as big as the starting radius. A value of -2 means that the ending radius will half of the size of the starting radius. A value of 1 means that the radius will not change during the animation. Not used when radius variation of provided_params param is 0.
Desired vertical distance in m. If negative, the spiral will be directed to the ground. Not used when vertical distance of provided_params param is 0.
The number of revolution (in turn). Positive value makes a clockwise spiral, negative is anti-clockwise. Example: 1.5 makes an entire turn plus half of a turn
Desired play mode. Not used when play mode of provided_params param is 0.
